qas.question: Who did the central Junta fall to?
After King Ferdinand died, who remained under Spanish rule?
When did the Spanish-American war occur?
Where were the Portuguese capacities centralized?

context: When the Central Junta fell to <a0_0>the French<a0_0/>, numerous new Juntas appeared all across the Americas, eventually resulting in a chain of newly independent countries stretching from Argentina and Chile in the south, to Mexico in the north. After the death of the <a1_0>king Ferdinand VII<a1_0/>, in 1833, only <a2_0>Cuba and Puerto Rico<a2_0/> remained under Spanish rule, until the Spanish–American War <a3_0>in 1898<a3_0/>. Unlike the Spanish, the Portuguese did not divide their colonial territory in America. The captaincies they created were subdued to a centralized administration in <a4_0>Salvador<a4_0/> (later relocated to Rio de Janeiro) which reported directly to the Portuguese Crown until its independence in 1822, becoming the Empire of Brazil.
